newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midwest direct hogs steady-off $1 - dealers.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midwest direct hogs steady-off $1 - dealers.

text.p: U.S. Midwest direct cash hogs early Wednesday sold steady to $1.00 per cwt lower as packers continued to fight unprofitable operating margins by bidding and paying lower for hogs, livestock dealers said.

A recent slide in wholesale pork prices contributed to the weak margins, they said. The lower hog prices also were bringing in a few more hogs as farmers are reluctant to hang onto them when prices are falling, sources said.
Iowa and southern Minnesota hogs sold $0.50 lower at $57.00 to $58.00 in the country and $58.50 to $59.00 at plants, packer buyers and dealers there said.
Illinois hogs sold steady to $0.50 lower at $57.50 to $58.00 in the country and $58.50 to $59.00 at plants, livestock dealers said.
Indiana hogs sold $0.50 to $1.00 lower at $57.50 to $58.00 in the country and $58.50 to $59.00 at plants.
Ohio hogs sold steady at $57.00 to $58.00 in the country and up to $60.00 at plants.
